TypeSignature.Value: public class AccessRule<T> : System.Security.AccessControl.AccessRule where T : struct
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AccessRule`1<struct .ctor (class System.ValueType) T> extends System.Security.AccessControl.AccessRule
Public Class AccessRule(Of T) Inherits AccessRule
generic <typename T> where T : value classpublic ref class AccessRule : System::Security::AccessControl::AccessRule
type AccessRule<'T (requires 'T : struct)> = class inherit AccessRule

Docs.typeparam: The access rights type for the access rule.
Docs.summary: Represents a combination of a user's identity, an access mask, and an access control type (allow or deny). An AccessRule`1 object also contains information about the how the rule is inherited by child objects and how that inheritance is propagated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Access rights (permissions) are type T, which you can type-cast to or from an int. For example, you can cast a <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights> as the access rights type, and then use the instance normally. In contrast, <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessRule> always takes access rights of type int.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccessRule'1 class by using the specified values.

Docs.summary: Gets the rights of the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property contains the same information as the AccessMask property, but cast as type \<T>.
